name: Kevin Lee
label: Deputy Chief Credit Officer @ AIG
summary: Marrying insurance markets with capital markets.

highlights: Drive entry and exit discipline in underwriting of captive fronting programs, loss-sensitive casualty accounts, trade finance, political risk insurance; partner with clients to create bespoke solutions that meet coverage/actuarial/tax/collateral requirements; adjudicate exceptional referrals with the second highest credit authority in the company.

Match the most profitable risks with the most efficient capital on our balance sheet by steering structured credit, infrastructure credit, and fund finance exposures to the correct insurance/investment platform.

Optimize risk management for a $100B+ credit portfolio of investments and insurance by digitizing the technology stack, allowing for higher-conviction underwriting and data that win reinsurance placements.

Anticipate systemic risks, research market controversies, formulate active views quickly, and communicate portfolio implications and corroborating data to insurance, investments, and AIG's Group Risk Committee.
Assume interim leadership of the reinsurance credit team, outsourced half of team activities, eliminated or automated a quarter of remaining activities, and saved $1.0M.

work_experience.position: Head of Risk, Global Credit & Specialty Insurance
highlights: Led the end-to-end risk management of AIG's $3B global credit & specialty insurance business and assumed backup responsibilties for the commercial property business in turnaround and realignment situations.

Communicated technical insights to business heads; partnered with the business/reinsurance/actuaries/catastrophe modelers to execute strategic actions, utilizing risk-adjusted performance targets to identify profitable growth opportunities and prune underperforming programs.
Steered divestment of $200M of aviation premiums after identifying unfavorable risk-reward profiles under the reinsurance progression.

Authored annual risk review of business plans for global property, credit, and specialty to inform the AIG Board's sign-off, leading to pruning of the programs business and investments in other businesses.

Promoted four times in four years; partnered with bankers and senior management to rate debt securities of property-casualty, multiline, and mortgage insurers and reinsurers in the US, Bermuda, UK, Europe, and Russia.
Led ratings franchise for $3.3 billion of catastrophe bonds and other insurance-linked securities as the in-house actuary; partnered with bankers and issuers to design securities that could be rated.

Developed content library by publishing industry-leading credit research including Japan Earthquake Q&A (top-ranked sell-side: “Nicely done and extremely useful”, reposted by Dowling & Partners); Mortgage Insurance (Freddie Mac: “Excellent analysis of the state of the industry”); Sidecars (CEO: “Best research [on the topic] anywhere on the street.”); Reinsurance Buyer Survey (EVP: “unique...nothing similar”)
Drove field execution using controllable income statements to mobilize agency plant, steer pricing, and guide capital allocation; conducted competitive intelligence of rivals.

Recovered $50M in redundant reserves by negotiating access to MGA data and spearheading comprehensive audits of a high-priority run-off book. (Division Head: “someone finally got the reserves right”).
